page.title: 06LOSSIEMOUTH GOLF COURSE.
page.content: One of the main attractions for tourists in Lossiemouth is its 18 hole championship golf course.The very first pioneers from Elgin laid out the original 6 hole course in 1889.In 1981 the Northern Open Championship was held there.Every year,the Moray Open Championship is held here,with competitors coming from all over Scotland. There is also a small 9 hole golf course,which is ideal for young,aspiring golfers.Many hazards are incorporated in the 18 hole courses,such as "dog-legs",whins,elevated greens and nasty bunkers.One is aptly named "Hell's Bunker"beside the 18th hole of the original course.Many golfers return again and again to enjoy the pleasure and the challenge of the Lossiemouth Golf Course.
